thread.title: WATCH || Boogie's emotional goodbye to Sacramento
thread.title_full: WATCH || Boogie's emotional goodbye to Sacramento

title: WATCH || Boogie's emotional goodbye to Sacramento
text:
WATCH || Boogie's emotional goodbye to Sacramento Watch as DeMarcus Cousins fights back tears and says his emotional goodbye to the city of Sacramento.   
DeMarcus Cousins had said repeatedly he wanted to retire and leave a legacy in the city of Sacramento. 
That dream came to an end this week when the Kings dealt Cousins to the New Orleans Pelicans. 
Kings general manager Vlade Divac took some parting shots at Cousins in the media Monday, but he did not return the favor. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
At a going away party in Sacramento Monday night, Cousins said his emotional goodbye to the city in which he spent the first six and a half years of his professional career. 
"My love for this city will never change," Cousins said, fighting back tears. 
Cousins has been extremely active in the Sacramento community and said he will continue to be. 
"Even though I'm gone, it will still be the same. I'm still looking out for these kids. Every family in this city matters to me. Everything is the same. I'm just not in a Kings uniform anymore." Author
